question: What are the college office hours?
answer: Office hours are Monday–Saturday, 9:00 AM – 5:30 PM (closed on Sundays and public holidays). Lunch break 1:00 – 1:30 PM.

question: How can I contact the Admissions Helpdesk?
answer: Email: admissions@college.edu, Phone: +91 90000 00001. Desk Location: AAA Building, Room 102. Working hours: 10:00 AM – 5:00 PM (Mon–Fri).

question: How do I get or reissue my ID card?
answer: New ID cards are issued 1 week after joining. Lost cards can be reissued at the AAA section; reissue fee is ₹1000.

question: How do I pay fees?
answer: All fee payments are made on the college ERP. All common payment modes are accepted.

question: Where are fee deadlines shown and are there fines?
answer: Fee deadlines are displayed in the ERP. Late payments may attract fines as per ERP notifications.

question: Where can students see the timetable?
answer: Open Student > Timetable in the portal to view and download your timetable. Faculty can upload/update from Faculty > Timetable.

question: What is the minimum attendance requirement?
answer: A minimum of 75% attendance is required in each subject.

question: Where are study materials uploaded and how do I access them?
answer: Faculty upload materials under Faculty > Material. Students can access them under Student > Material, filtered by subject/branch/semester.

question: How are exam schedules announced?
answer: Exam schedules are shared via prior emails and announced in the app (Exam section and Notices).

question: What is the marks/assessment structure?
answer: Mid Term: 25 marks, End Term: 40 marks, Internals: 35 marks (total 100).

question: Where can students see their marks?
answer: Marks are visible on the ERP and within the app under Student > Marks.

question: How to join a society?
answer: First-year students are selected through interviews. In second year, students can volunteer to become members. Each society has one head (shown in the app), with heads/coordinators managing members.

question: Who can schedule society events?
answer: Only society Heads and Coordinators can schedule events. Announcements appear in the app under society pages and Upcoming Events.

question: How do I report or claim Lost & Found items?
answer: Use the Lost & Found page in the app to report or claim items. Alternatively, email lostfound@college.edu.

question: Who do I contact for IT/portal issues?
answer: IT Helpdesk: support@college.edu, Phone: +91 90000 00002. Location: CS Block, Lab 101. Hours: 10:00 AM – 6:00 PM (Mon–Fri).

question: Whom to contact for academic/branch matters?
answer: For quick guidance, reach out to class seniors. For official concerns, contact your Department HOD (e.g., cse-hod@college.edu).

question: What are the library timings and borrowing limits?
answer: Library is open from 6:00 AM to 12:00 AM. Borrowing limit: 4 books per student. No borrowing fee.

question: How do I contact the Hostel Office and what is the process?
answer: Hostel Office: hostel@college.edu, Phone: +91 90000 00003. Office hours: 10:00 AM – 6:00 PM. Apply via ERP Hostel module and submit documents at the Hostel Office.

question: How to contact the Placement Cell and where are updates posted?
answer: Placement Cell: placements@college.edu, Phone: +91 90000 00004. Updates are posted on the app Notices and the Placement Telegram channel.

question: What is the minimum CGPA criteria for placements?
answer: Minimum CGPA 6.5 with no active backlogs is required to sit for most drives. Example: A-tier companies may require 7.0+, B-tier 6.5+.

question: Are there any dress code rules and mobile phone policies?
answer: No formal dress code. Mobile phones are not allowed in laboratories.
